name: Mount Kilimanjaro
hint: Highest peak in Africa, a freestanding volcanic mountain in Tanzania

name: Mount Kenya
hint: Second-highest mountain in Africa, an extinct volcano in central Kenya

name: Ras Dashen
hint: Highest mountain in Ethiopia, in the Simien Mountains

name: Mount Stanley
hint: Highest peak of the Rwenzori Mountains, on the Uganda-DRC border

name: Mount Meru
hint: Second-highest mountain in Tanzania, near Arusha

name: Mount Toubkal
hint: Highest peak in North Africa, in Morocco's Atlas Mountains

name: Mount Cameroon
hint: Highest peak in West Africa, an active volcano near the coast

name: Drakensberg
hint: Great escarpment mountain range in eastern South Africa

name: Atlas Mountains
hint: Mountain range stretching across Morocco, Algeria, and Tunisia

name: Simien Mountains
hint: Dramatic mountain range in northern Ethiopia, home to the gelada baboon

name: Mount Elgon
hint: Extinct shield volcano on the Kenya-Uganda border with the largest caldera in Africa

name: Mount Nyiragongo
hint: Active volcano in DRC famous for its persistent lava lake in the crater

name: Rwenzori Mountains
hint: Legendary 'Mountains of the Moon' on the Uganda-DRC border, often shrouded in mist

name: Table Mountain
hint: Iconic flat-topped mountain overlooking Cape Town, one of the New7Wonders of Nature

name: Mount Karisimbi
hint: Highest of the eight Virunga volcanoes, on the Rwanda-DRC border

name: Emi Koussi
hint: Highest peak in the Sahara, a volcanic summit in Chad's Tibesti Mountains

name: Thabana Ntlenyana
hint: Highest peak in southern Africa, located in Lesotho's Maluti Mountains

name: Mount Mulanje
hint: Highest peak in Malawi, a dramatic granite inselberg rising from the plains

name: Hoggar Mountains
hint: Highland region in the central Sahara of southern Algeria with volcanic peaks

name: Virunga Mountains
hint: Chain of volcanoes in East Africa, famous as the home of mountain gorillas

name: Tibesti Mountains
hint: Remote mountain range in northern Chad, highest mountains in the Sahara region

name: Mount Ol Doinyo Lengai
hint: Only active volcano producing natrocarbonatite lava, sacred to the Maasai in Tanzania

name: Air Mountains
hint: Mountain range rising from the Sahara in northern Niger, a UNESCO World Heritage Site

name: Mount Binga
hint: Highest mountain in Mozambique, located on the border with Zimbabwe

name: Bale Mountains
hint: Mountain range in southeastern Ethiopia, home to the Ethiopian wolf
